title: Sharding: Splitting Databases Across Servers
description: A quick, practical guide to Sharding: Splitting Databases Across Servers.

hook.text: Instagram's database grew to billions of photos. One server couldn't hold it all. They split it across hundreds.

discovery.text: Each shard operates independently, allowing parallel processing and near-linear scaling with more servers.

twist.text: Cross-shard queries are nightmares. If a query needs data from multiple shards, performance often collapses.

climax.text: Sharding trades simplicity for scale. Companies adopt it reluctantly â€” only when a single server truly can't cope.

punchline.text: When one database isn't enough, split it. But prepare for the complexity.

quiz.question: What is database sharding?
options: Splitting a database across multiple servers to distribute load
